Introduction: The Walt Disney Company (NYSE: DIS) has been a focal point of investor attention throughout 2024, with significant fluctuations in its stock price and numerous pivotal events shaping its financial landscape. As of September 16, 2024, Disney's stock has experienced a tumultuous year, marked by both impressive gains and notable declines. This report delves into the key events and financial performance of Disney, providing a comprehensive analysis of the factors influencing its stock price.
Stock Performance Overview: Disney's stock has faced a challenging period, with shares moving lower for the fifth consecutive month in August 2024, down 26% since the end of March ([The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2024/09/01/3-dates-for-disney-stock-investors-to-circle-in-se/)). Despite this decline, the stock remains marginally higher for the year, thanks to substantial gains in the first quarter of 2024, driven by a proxy battle victory in early April. However, these gains have been largely eroded by subsequent market performance.

Key Financial Results.Q3 2024 Earnings: Disney reported its third-quarter earnings for fiscal 2024 on August 7, 2024. The company achieved revenues of $23.2 billion, up from $22.3 billion in the prior-year quarter ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walt-disney-company-reports-third-105000788.html)). Income before income taxes improved significantly to $3.1 billion, compared to a loss of $0.1 billion in the same period last year. Diluted earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter were $1.43, a substantial improvement from a loss of $0.25 in the prior-year quarter. Excluding certain items, diluted EPS increased to $1.39 from $1.03 ([Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/business-wire/20240807530027/the-walt-disney-company-reports-third-quarter-and-nine-months-earnings-for-fiscal-2024)).
Key Financial Results.Year-to-Date Performance: For the nine months ended June 29, 2024, Disney reported revenues of $68.8 billion, up from $67.7 billion in the same period last year. Net income for the nine months was $5.2 billion, compared to $2.7 billion in the prior-year period. Adjusted EPS for the nine months increased by 35% ([Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/business-wire/20240807530027/the-walt-disney-company-reports-third-quarter-and-nine-months-earnings-for-fiscal-2024)).

Key Events and Developments.Proxy Battle Victory: One of the most significant events for Disney in 2024 was its victory in a proxy battle in early April. This victory was seen as a positive development, as it allowed the company to implement its strategic initiatives without the interference of activist groups ([The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2024/09/01/3-dates-for-disney-stock-investors-to-circle-in-se/)).
Key Events and Developments.Streaming Business Profitability: Disney's streaming business achieved profitability for the first time in Q3 2024, a quarter ahead of previous guidance. This milestone was driven by strong performance in its direct-to-consumer (DTC) segment, which includes Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walt-disney-company-reports-third-105000788.html)).
Key Events and Developments.Theme Park and Box Office Performance: Disney's theme parks and box office performance have been mixed. While the company announced major additions to its theme parks worldwide, theme park trends have softened at its largest resort. On the box office front, Disney broke records with two of its summertime theatrical releases, contributing to its strong financial performance ([The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2024/09/09/can-disney-stock-avoid-falling-for-the-sixth-month/)).
Key Events and Developments.Legal and Licensing Disputes: Disney has faced challenges in its media networks segment, including a licensing dispute with DirecTV that resulted in a blackout of Disney's networks for millions of viewers. This dispute was resolved in mid-September, restoring ESPN and ABC-owned stations to DirecTV's service ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/DIS/news/)).

Valuation and Analyst Opinions.Valuation Metrics: Disney's stock is currently trading at less than 18 times its expected earnings for the fiscal year ending this month. This valuation is relatively low compared to historical levels, making it an attractive option for value investors ([The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2024/09/09/can-disney-stock-avoid-falling-for-the-sixth-month/)).
Valuation and Analyst Opinions.Analyst Ratings: J.P. Morgan maintains a "Buy" rating on Disney, citing the potential for recovery in its theme parks and cruise businesses, as well as continued growth in its streaming segment ([Business Insider](https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/dis-stock?op=1)). Additionally, Zacks Investment Research has highlighted Disney as a stock to watch, noting its earnings growth and price strength ([Zacks](https://www.zacks.com/stock/news/2332019/earnings-growth-price-strength-make-walt-disney-dis-a-stock-to-watch)).

Future Outlook.Upcoming Catalysts: Several key dates and events in September 2024 could influence Disney's stock performance. These include the release of highly anticipated movies on Disney+ and the D23 exposition, which is expected to generate significant media attention and potentially boost subscriber numbers ([The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2024/09/01/3-dates-for-disney-stock-investors-to-circle-in-se/)).
Future Outlook.Strategic Priorities: Disney's CEO, Robert A. Iger, has emphasized the company's focus on four strategic priorities: creative studios, streaming, sports, and experiences. The company's balanced portfolio of businesses is expected to drive earnings growth in the coming quarters ([Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/business-wire/20240807530027/the-walt-disney-company-reports-third-quarter-and-nine-months-earnings-for-fiscal-2024)).

Conclusion: The Walt Disney Company has experienced a volatile year in 2024, with significant fluctuations in its stock price driven by a mix of positive and negative developments. Despite recent declines, the company's strong financial performance, strategic initiatives, and upcoming catalysts provide reasons for optimism. Investors should closely monitor key events and financial updates in the coming months to assess the potential for a recovery in Disney's stock price.
